Method Detail

splitURL

public static java.lang.String[] splitURL(java.lang.String url)
                                   throws UrlFormatException
Splits the URL in the parts.

E.g: http://www.site.com:8080/streams/MP3/file.mp3#1 

 0: protocol  (e.g. http)
 1: host      (e.g. www.site.com)
 2: port      (e.g. 8080)
 3: path      (e.g. /streams/MP3)
 4: file      (e.g. file.mp3)
 5: anchor    (e.g. 1)

Using: 

 // Split URL to Site and File parts
 String[] urlParts = Utils.splitURL(url);
 String site = urlParts[1] + ":" + urlParts[2]; // host:port
 urlParts[0] = "";
 urlParts[1] = "";
 urlParts[2] = "";
 String file = Utils.mergeURL(urlParts);

LIMITATION: URL must end with a slash if it is a directory.

Parameters:
url - URL to split.
Returns:
String array.
Throws:
UrlFormatException - if parsing error occuring.

mergeURL

public static java.lang.String mergeURL(java.lang.String[] url)
Make URL from URL parts. For array structure see splitURL(java.lang.String).

Using: 

 // Split URL to Site and File parts
 String[] urlParts = Utils.splitURL(url);
 String site = urlParts[1] + ":" + urlParts[2]; // host:port
 urlParts[0] = "";
 urlParts[1] = "";
 urlParts[2] = "";
 String file = Utils.mergeURL(urlParts);

Parameters:
url - URL parts.
Returns:
Whole URL.
See Also:
splitURL(java.lang.String)

friendlyException

public static java.lang.String friendlyException(java.lang.Throwable t)
Make exception information more friendly.

Example: 

 String exeptInfo = friendlyException("javax.microedition.media.MediaException: Some text");
 // Now exeptInfo is "MediaException: Some text"

Parameters:
t - Exception object.
Returns:
"Friendly" exception string.
